page.title: 17THE MARKET PLACE IN DEVIZES.
page.content: Devizes Market has been held at the same site for the last 300 years. Originally a cattle market it has, during the last 30 years,become a lively,bustling general market. It now consists of 63 stalls with wares ranging from fish, vegetables, fruit and toys,to materials and household goods. It is now run by Kennet District Council with a fee collector known as the Toby Man, Mr.T.Doyle.He is also in charge of outdoor swimming pool run by the council. The Market Place combines Historic buildings including the Bear Hotel, Corn Exchange,the Shambles,the Pelican,the Black Swan and the Ruth Pierce Monument with many banks, building societies and modern shops. On a Thursday morning it is an exciting place to be.
